Key Arguments: The proposed legislation is seen as a threat to democracy and free speech.
The author believes that the bill will lead to censorship and control of media, akin to totalitarian regimes.
There is a distrust in government and regulatory bodies, perceived as being captured by corporate interests.
The author argues that the real threat to safety, wellbeing, and democracy comes from censorship, not misinformation.
The bill is viewed as hypocritical, with the government and certain media being exempt from scrutiny.
Notable Quotes: This bill, if passed, will spell the end of democracy in this country.
Censorship is incompatible with democracy - the right to free speech is paramount.
The facade is that this bill will 'protect us'. This is the song of every wannabe dictator in history.
